DOC.brief_title: Erythropoietin + Iron Therapy Anemic Patients Undergoing Aortic Valve Replacement
DOC.detailed_description: STUDY DESIGN Prospective randomize double blind study include patient diagnose severe symptomatic aortic stenosis anemia undergo aortic valve replacement . The patient identify cardiac surgery / aortic stenosis outpatient clinic hospitalization department Institut Universitaire de Cardiologie et de Pneumologie de Quebec . SAMPLE SIZE 100 patient ( 50 patient per group ) .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients ≥60year old 2 . Symptomatic aortic stenosis clinical indication transcatheter aortic valve replacement , regardless simultaneous percutaneous coronary intervention 3 . Anemia define accord World Health Organization ( WHO ) definition 69 : 1 . Men : Hemoglobin < 130 g/L 2 . Women : < 120 g/L 1 . Contraindication transcatheter aortic valve replacement . 2 . Erythropoietin treatment within last 30 day Aortic Valve Replacement 3 . Known anemia due aplasia , hemoglobinopathy active bleeding require blood transfusion within last 30 day Aortic Valve Replacement 4 . Ferritin > 800 µg/L 5 . Uncontrolled hypertension ( Blood pressure > 175/95 ) 6 . Platelet count > 450,000/L 7 . Recent myocardial infarction require percutaneous coronary intervention disable stroke ( within last 30 day ) 8 . Dialysis patient 9 .
